Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation in Pennsylvania by stating that the state "never opened" when in fact it has been in the "green" phase of reopening since July 3rd.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the assertion that Pennsylvania "never opened."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the only way for a state to be considered "open" is if it has returned to normal and all businesses and schools are fully operational, which may not be a fair or accurate assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the current situation in Pennsylvania, such as the ongoing presence of COVID-19 cases and the cautious approach taken by the state government to prevent further spread of the virus.
